Module com.example.pingpong
Package com.example.pingpong.View

Class GameMenu

java.lang.Object
com.example.pingpong.View.GameMenu
public class GameMenu extends Object
The GameMenu class is responsible for creating and managing the user interface for the game menu. It handles the interaction with various game settings and control elements, allowing the user to start new games, load existing games, adjust game settings, and access other game-related information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameMenu(MenuListener menuListener)
    Constructs a new GameMenu with the specified menuListener which handles actions triggered by the menu.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameMenu

      public GameMenu(MenuListener menuListener)
      Constructs a new GameMenu with the specified menuListener which handles actions triggered by the menu.
      Parameters:
      menuListener - The listener for menu actions.

  • Method Details

    • initializeMenu

      public void initializeMenu()
      Initializes all menu items and setting controls required for the game's menu.

    • handleRadioButtons

      public void handleRadioButtons()
      Configures the radio buttons for racket size and thickness settings.

    • handleRadioSelection

      public void handleRadioSelection(int selectedSize, int selectedThickness)
      Sets the selected state of the radio buttons based on the provided racket size and thickness. This method is used to synchronize the radio button selections with current game settings, such as when loading saved settings or resetting the menu to reflect updated values.
      Parameters:
      selectedSize - The selected size of the racket, where 1 represents "Large", 2 "Medium", and 3 "Small".
      selectedThickness - The thickness of the racket, where 1 represents "Thick", 2 "Average", and 3 "Slim".

    • handleMenuAction

      public void handleMenuAction()
      Handles user interactions from the menu, including starting games, loading games, adjusting settings, and accessing additional information.

    • menuMain

      public void menuMain()
      Constructs the main menu layout, grouping all settings and control elements.

    • menuMainSettings

      public javafx.scene.layout.HBox menuMainSettings(javafx.scene.control.Label settingsLabel, javafx.scene.Node settingAction)
      Creates a settings layout with given label and action control.
      Parameters:
      settingsLabel - Label for the setting.
      settingAction - The control associated with the setting (e.g., slider, button).
      Returns:
      An HBox containing both the label and the control.

    • loadMenu

      public void loadMenu()
      Loads and configures the game loading menu with options to load various saved games.

    • menuMainPlayers

      public javafx.scene.layout.HBox menuMainPlayers(javafx.scene.control.Label label, javafx.scene.control.TextField textField)
      Helper method for creating player name input fields layout.
      Parameters:
      label - The label for the player name field.
      textField - The text field for entering the player name.
      Returns:
      An HBox containing the label and the text field.

    • makeGameMenu

      public javafx.scene.layout.HBox makeGameMenu()
      Constructs a control menu with game control buttons like pause, restart, and settings.
      Returns:
      An HBox containing the control buttons.

    • resetMenu

      public void resetMenu()
      Resets the menu to reflect the current game settings.

      public javafx.scene.layout.VBox getMenuMain()
